subclassFeature.name: True Talent
entries: Once in several generations, there comes one born with such raw potential and talent, that they can challenge minor deitys in acts of skill. This ability oft ends in the deity betting power upon contests in which the deity looses, and gives a mortal of talent the ability to cast magic

subclassFeature.name: Gambits Reward
entries: Upon choosing this sorcerous origin you gain the ability to play any instrument of your choice at an exemplary level, when you use this instrument as your spellcasting focus, spells that use an attack roll gain +1 hit and damage.  This increases to +2 at 6th level, +3 at 14th level, and +4 at 18th level.

subclassFeature.name: Uncontainable Preformance
entries: Starting at 1st level, the musical power embued in you in by your winnings allows you to ensorcel any who would observe your preformances. Once per combat you choose one creature within 30 ft that you can see and that can hear your music, they must make a wisdom saving throw DC equal to your spellcasting. If they fail, all ranged attacks made against this target have advantage until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Unnaturally Talented
entries: Starting at 6th level, your magical adeptness grows beyond the normal constraints of a preformer. You may expend 3 sorcery points to animate an instrument that you are carrying, and have proficiency with. It has an AC equal to yours, a movement of 10 ft, 1 health, and mimicks spells that you cast on a target. It takes your bonus action to move it, and it acts on your turn. It cannot concentrate, may only cast up to 3rd level spells and any spells mimicked consume a spell slot; It will mimick your metamagics.

subclassFeature.name: Army of Instruments
entries: Starting at 14th level, you may use Unnaturally Talented up to 3 times at the same time, all animated instruments gain the benefits of Gambits Reward, and do not consume spell slots beyond the first animated instrument.

subclassFeature.name: Grand Finale
entries: At 18th level, once per long rest you may use your bonus action to unleash all your power for a grand finale. For the rest of your turn Unnaturally Talented costs 1 sorcery point, after this turn ends you are lethargic for 1 round and any amount of instruments summoned over 3 become mudane at the end of your turn
